page.title: 14Ecology Littlebourne Area
page.content: The area has an active conservation Society whixh tries to preserve the rural character. A continuing concern is the extraction of water from the river + bore holes affecting its flow. Gravel extraction is also a problem. A local guide has been produced for W'breux and 2 local history booklets for L'bourne. Trees have been planted in all the villages + on Howletts Car Park + the lime trees pleached in W'breux. There is a continuing interest in listed buildings + conservation Areas + planning applications concerning them. Films + footpath walks are organised + litter sweeps to clear rubbish from the country lanes. The footpaths are of 2 types, the inland footpaths joining parts of the village + the outland footpaths to the small settlements e.g.Garrington, Woolton, Swanton.
